channel.title: Can SCAR create text files?
channel.description:
Can SCAR create text files like batch files can? I am wondering if an account maker script could make a text file containing the usernames it finally decides on and the passwords. It could be as an include and they could just be constants. Then a tutorial island script could read that textfile.
If SCAR can't create text files, then is there a way for the account maker and tutorial island script to be 1 script? I mean without the user having to drag the crosshairs again. Is there a way for one script to go from one client to another?
The goal situation would be the user inputs say 20 usernames and passwords, maybe with secondary usernames incase they are taken. The user can then run the script overnight or whatever. Then the script will create the accounts, and put them all through tutorial island. Then the user will have a bunch of accounts in lumby (ready for doric quest and/or rune mysteries scripts :P). Is there any way to do this without the user re entering the usernames and passwords between the account making phase and the tut island phase?

item.title: Can SCAR create text files?
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

Thank you! This makes things so much easier. I wrote a script for testing isuptext and words to look for that created screenshots, and I had to cram all the report info into the screenshot filename lol. And now I can make an account maker tell a tutislander the usernames and passwords!

item.description:
@ScarScape wrote:

How can i make scar to write text to next line in my text file? I wrote text and then make it to press enter, but it didn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Can SCAR create text files?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Yes, SCAR can create text files (and screenshots, but thats something else)

Press F1 while in SCAR and search for “file functions”

the main function is called

function RewriteFile(Path: string; Shared: Boolean): Integer;

this is a function for writing in it (strings)

function WriteFileString(FileNum: Integer; s: string): Boolean;

How to use:

program maketext
var file:integer;

begin
file:=rewritefile(apppath+'File.txt',false)
if(writefilestring(file,'username number 1'+chr(13))then
 writeln('file written')
end.

Read full topic

item.title: Can SCAR create text files?
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

Emaziz:

Lol, that would be great for me! But do you know any way that the account maker does change username var and password var after making a account? Would be very helpfull! =) =P

What do you mean? I haven’t put much thought into this because I’m working on the tut island first, but I was thinking of using a dynamic user array hooked up to a form. The form would have an add user button, and spots first choice username, second choice, password and maybe the age range drop down. Then it when it creates the account, it would have another dynamic array called usernamefinal or something that it would write to so the user would know what username it settled on. This could be in the report/debug box or written to the filename of a screenshot. Is that what you’re talking about?

Does anyone know if SCAR can create textfiles???

Read full topic
